required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Innovation of Breakfast Cereals and Snacks for Control of Appetite and Post-Prandial Glycemia
clinical_study.official_title: Innovation of Breakfast Cereals and Snacks for Control of Appetite and Post-Prandial Glycemia

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of the proposed research is to investigate the effects of novel snack products differing in macronutrient composition, fibre and sugar content on post-prandial glycemia and short-term appetite control in healthy adults.

primary_outcome.description: Food intake (kCal) is assessed 120 min after consumption of the treatments, using an ad libitum pizza lunch design. Participants are asked to eat, during a 20-min period, until feeling comfortably full

secondary_outcome.description: Satiety scores (mm) are assessed using 100-mm "Motivation to Eat" visual analog scale questionnaires. A composite score of the four appetite questions, including Desire to Eat, Hunger, Fullness and Prospective Food Consumption, in the "Motivation to Eat" visual analog scale is calculated to obtain the average appetite score for statistical analysis

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 to 120 min (pre-ad libitum lunch) and 140 to 260 min (post-ad libitum lunch) after consumption of treatments
secondary_outcome.description: Blood glucose (mmol/L) is measured using finger prick capillary blood samples

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 to 120 min (pre-ad libitum lunch) and 140 to 260 min (post-ad libitum lunch) after consumption of treatments
secondary_outcome.description: Blood insulin (Î¼U/mL) is measured using finger prick capillary blood samples

other_outcome.description: Participants are asked to complete a 24-hour Food Recall starting at dinner the night before each study session and ending at dinner the day of that session.

arm_group.description: Dietary intervention: 190 Kcal, 12g fat, 14g carbohydrate, 5g fibre, 6g sugar, 10g protein
Dietary intervention: 200 Kcal, 15g fat, 12g carbohydrate, 5g fibre, 4g sugar, 8g protein
Dietary intervention: 210 Kcal, 16g fat, 12g carbohydrate, 2g fibre, 6g sugar, 6g protein
Dietary intervention: White bread (190 Kcal, 2g fat, 37g carbohydrate, 2g fibre, 3g sugar, 6g protein)
Dietary intervention: Soft baked pretzel (190 Kcal, 2g fat, 38g carbohydrate, 2g fibre, 6g sugar, 4g protein)

intervention.description: All arms are given to all participants, in a randomized order

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy, non-smoking individuals aged 18-55 years with a body mass index of 20.0-29.9 kg/m2
Exclusion Criteria:
- Smokers, individuals with diabetes or other cardiometabolic diseases, persons who suffer from gastrointestinal disorders or have had gastric surgery, or people who regularly use bulk laxatives
- Women with irregular menstruation or who use hormonal contraceptives or hormone replacement therapy
- Individuals who regularly skip breakfast, have allergies to any of the test food ingredients, or who follow a restrictive diet

facility.name: Department of Nutritional Sciences, University of Toronto
